akismet.enable.doc: If `true`, entries will be checked via Akismet for spam

akismet.siteUrl.doc: Site URL form the Akismet account

akismet.fields.author.doc: Field name for the entry Author's Name

akismet.fields.authorEmail.doc: Field name for the entry Author's Email

akismet.fields.authorUrl.doc: Field name for the entry Author's URL

akismet.fields.content.doc: Field name for the entry Content

allowedFields.doc: An array with the names of the allowed fields. If any of the fields sent is not in this list, the entry will be discarded and an error will be thrown.

branch.doc: Name of the repository branch being used

commitMessage.doc: Commit message for entries pushed to the repository (Placeholders allowed)

extension.doc: Extension for the data files being pushed to the repository. If empty, it fallbacks to the `format` option

filename.doc: Name for the data files being pushed to the repository (Placeholders allowed)

format.doc: Format of the data files being pushed to the repository

generatedFields.doc: List of fields to be appended to entries automatically

moderation.doc: If `true`, a pull request with the data files will be created on the repository. Otherwise, data files will be pushed to `branch` directly.

path.doc: Path to the directory where data files will be stored (Placeholders allowed)

pullRequestBody.doc: Text to be used as the Pull Request Body when moderation is enabled

requiredFields.doc: An array with the names of the fields that are required for an entry. If any of these fields are absent, the entry will be discarded and an error will be thrown.

recaptcha.enable.doc: If `true`, reCAPTCHA validation will be required

transforms.doc: List of transformations to be applied to the fields
